question: Which artists have more than 10 albums?
SQL: SELECT ArtistId FROM Album GROUP BY ArtistId HAVING COUNT(AlbumId) > 10;

question: List the first and last names of customers who live in Brazil.
SQL: SELECT FirstName, LastName FROM Customer WHERE Country = 'Brazil';

question: Show all tracks that are longer than 5 minutes.
SQL: SELECT Name FROM Track WHERE Milliseconds > 300000;

question: Which employees are sales managers?
SQL: SELECT FirstName, LastName FROM Employee WHERE Title = 'Sales Manager';

question: Get the email addresses of customers in the city of Paris.
SQL: SELECT Email FROM Customer WHERE City = 'Paris';

question: Find the total amount spent by each customer.
SQL: SELECT CustomerId, SUM(Total) FROM Invoice GROUP BY CustomerId;

question: List the top 5 most expensive tracks.
SQL: SELECT Name FROM Track ORDER BY UnitPrice DESC LIMIT 5;

question: Which tracks belong to the 'Rock' genre?
SQL: SELECT Name FROM Track WHERE GenreId = (SELECT GenreId FROM Genre WHERE Name = 'Rock');

question: Count the number of invoices for each country.
SQL: SELECT BillingCountry, COUNT(*) FROM Invoice GROUP BY BillingCountry;

question: Find the name of the artist who released the album 'Californication'.
SQL: SELECT Name FROM Artist WHERE ArtistId = (SELECT ArtistId FROM Album WHERE Title = 'Californication');

question: List all customers who have never made a purchase.
SQL: SELECT CustomerId FROM Customer WHERE CustomerId NOT IN (SELECT CustomerId FROM Invoice);

question: How many different genres are there?
SQL: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM Genre;

question: Find the average invoice total.
SQL: SELECT AVG(Total) FROM Invoice;

question: List employees who report to Steve Johnson.
SQL: SELECT FirstName, LastName FROM Employee WHERE ReportsTo = (SELECT EmployeeId FROM Employee WHERE FirstName = 'Steve' AND LastName = 'Johnson');

question: Which tracks were composed by 'AC/DC'?
SQL: SELECT Name FROM Track WHERE Composer = 'AC/DC';

question: Get the number of playlists available.
SQL: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM Playlist;

question: Which customers are from the USA and spent more than $30 total?
SQL: SELECT CustomerId FROM Customer WHERE Country = 'USA' AND CustomerId IN (SELECT CustomerId FROM Invoice GROUP BY CustomerId HAVING SUM(Total) > 30);

question: Show track names and their respective album titles.
SQL: SELECT t.Name, a.Title FROM Track t JOIN Album a ON t.AlbumId = a.AlbumId;

question: Find the most recently hired employee.
SQL: SELECT FirstName, LastName FROM Employee ORDER BY HireDate DESC LIMIT 1;

question: List invoices with a total greater than the average invoice total.
SQL: SELECT InvoiceId, Total FROM Invoice WHERE Total > (SELECT AVG(Total) FROM Invoice);

question: Which tracks have the word 'Love' in their title?
SQL: SELECT Name FROM Track WHERE Name LIKE '%Love%';

question: Find customers who have purchased tracks by 'Queen'.
SQL: SELECT DISTINCT c.CustomerId FROM Customer c JOIN Invoice i ON c.CustomerId = i.CustomerId JOIN InvoiceLine il ON i.InvoiceId = il.InvoiceId JOIN Track t ON il.TrackId = t.TrackId WHERE t.Composer = 'Queen';

question: List all media types available.
SQL: SELECT Name FROM MediaType;

question: Which city has the most customers?
SQL: SELECT City FROM Customer GROUP BY City ORDER BY COUNT(*) DESC LIMIT 1;

question: Find all employees who are not managers.
SQL: SELECT FirstName, LastName FROM Employee WHERE ReportsTo IS NOT NULL;

question: Get the total duration in minutes of all tracks.
SQL: SELECT SUM(Milliseconds)/60000.0 FROM Track;

question: How many tracks are in the 'Rock' playlist?
SQL: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM PlaylistTrack WHERE PlaylistId = (SELECT PlaylistId FROM Playlist WHERE Name = 'Rock');

question: Which customers have more than 2 invoices?
SQL: SELECT CustomerId FROM Invoice GROUP BY CustomerId HAVING COUNT(*) > 2;

question: List all albums with more than 15 tracks.
SQL: SELECT AlbumId FROM Track GROUP BY AlbumId HAVING COUNT(*) > 15;

question: Find customers who live in cities starting with 'L'.
SQL: SELECT FirstName, LastName FROM Customer WHERE City LIKE 'L%';
